If A kills B, why doesn’t god protect B given god is almighty?
If God chose non-action, free will of B would be hampered. If God protects B, free will of A would be hampered as well. Non-action is action, what god is doing is prioritizing the free will of the murderer A over the victim B.

Also if god is omniscient, he must know every choice you’ll make, so why does free will even exist? Any Christians can answer these two questions?

quote.msg:
If A kills B, why doesn’t god protect B given god is almighty?
If God chose non-action, free will of B would be hampered. If God protects B, free will of A would be hampered as well. Non-action is action, what god is doing is prioritizing the free will of the murderer A over the victim B.

Also if god is omniscient, he must know every choice you’ll make, so why does free will even exist? Any Christians can answer these two questions?

replies.msg:
Ok so you said god will judge A after A murdered B. B was already murdered, does judging A(putting A in eternal pain and torture) revives B?

Let’s start from A’s perspective now, does putting him in eternal pain and torture acts a sensible way to judge someone? Will A actually learn anything about the severity of his action? Will he be remorseful? The answer is an obvious no.

Judging someone would NOT revive the victim, would NOT be fair to A to put him in hell also. So where is the LOVE part you’re talking about?

Now let’s go through the God loves you part.
God: I love you, but if you don’t believe in me, I’ll put you in hell no matter how many goods you have done. I gave you a choice to believe in me, you didn’t treasure your free will, so go to hell!

Murderer: I gave you a choice, either give me your wallet or die. I gave you a choice to live, you didn’t treasure your free will, so you actually chose your own death!

Conclusion: both god and murderer loves you!

quote.msg:
Ok so you said god will judge A after A murdered B. B was already murdered, does judging A(putting A in eternal pain and torture) revives B?

Let’s start from A’s perspective now, does putting him in eternal pain and torture acts a sensible way to judge someone? Will A actually learn anything about the severity of his action? Will he be remorseful? The answer is an obvious no.

Judging someone would NOT revive the victim, would NOT be fair to A to put him in hell also. So where is the LOVE part you’re talking about?

Now let’s go through the God loves you part.
God: I love you, but if you don’t believe in me, I’ll put you in hell no matter how many goods you have done. I gave you a choice to believe in me, you didn’t treasure your free will, so go to hell!

Murderer: I gave you a choice, either give me your wallet or die. I gave you a choice to live, you didn’t treasure your free will, so you actually chose your own death!

Conclusion: both god and murderer loves you!
Brother, do you possess the capacity to speak cantonese ?

If God chose non-action, free will of B would be hampered. If God protects B, free will of A would be hampered as well. Non-action is action, what god is doing is prioritizing the free will of the murderer A over the victim B.

Also if god is omniscient, he must know every choice you’ll make, so why does free will even exist? Any Christians can answer these two questions?

God did not choose to act nothing, but he has determined a day(only father knows) that his son Jesus will come back and judge, why didnt he act instantly? lets take a think, dont u think murder A was a good man originally but he encounter sth. that might be injustice or unfairness then he lost his love and chose to be harmful to someone else for anything that good to him?
Jesus teaches us that keep our love until he come back, for GOD is love, love is never fail

You either act or don’t act. The matter of action is protection, NOT judging. He determined a day for judging you said. Let me explain how ridiculous is this crap!

God is almighty, he saw B got killed at a certain time period. He told himself hmm let me wait for a moment and JUDGE A later on, just let B die!

Wow god really loves B! Judging is never an instantaneous action, you wait and observe, then judge.

If you can actually prevent something, why even bother judging? The latter will not exist if you STOP the murderer!

God loves you!

replies.msg:
I can choose whatever path I want to go. Yet the point is the path is destined. So if god knows every path/decision I make, I’m not actually choosing my own path but following god’s path assigned to me. This is not free will.

No matter how small the sin is, you go to hell. But committing the sin is not my choice, I’m following god’s path(he is omniscient), he got the power the stop me from having sins(he is almighty). God loves me, he sets me up to have sins, and kicks me into hell!

Also if you’re trying to argue god’s existence or things that are created by god(heaven and hell for example), please stop using bible as a justification, this is really dumb and I’ve explained it somewhere up there(the subset thing).

You should read your second paragraph again, some people are destined that they CANNOT be saved. Then how the actual fuck you can say god loves all of us...

I’m not sure whether god can save you, one thing for sure is that thinking can curb stupidity!

quote.msg: Ok no sarcasm. If someone can logically dissect the point I’ve made, for sure I can! It is not possible to believe in something if one can’t prove it with logic.

God is not a thing. You will trust your brother even without proving him logical right, in case of you have very limited information.

For example, scientists said light is both particle and wave, will you believe it if you don't understand their papers? Usually, you will believe it since the scientists, in this case, are smarter than you and you trust their credits.

Isn’t this kindled by other factors? Take the brother case as an example, you believe him since you have something else(like love and compassion) altering your rational mind.

I believe in scientists and I trust their credits, yes I cannot deny that. Yet its validity can be tested by not using stuff that are limited to that theory. We can prove it’s validity by observation, logical deduction or something else. The point is, it can be proved.

Can you prove the existence of god? Through observation I can’t, through logical deduction I can’t, through tests I can’t.

For example, scientists said light is both particle and wave, will you believe it if you don't understand their papers? Usually, you will believe it since the scientists, in this case, are smarter than you and you trust their credits.

Isn’t this kindled by other factors? Take the brother case as an example, you believe him since you have something else(like love and compassion) altering your rational mind.

replies.msg: Given X is a subset of A, if A doesn’t even exist, X would NOT exist as well. Substitute A as god, X as bible and use it is quite obvious you can’t use bible to prove the existence of god. That’s why I said proving a theory using methods not limited to that theory is important

quote.msg:
Isn’t this kindled by other factors? Take the brother case as an example, you believe him since you have something else(like love and compassion) altering your rational mind.

I believe in scientists and I trust their credits, yes I cannot deny that. Yet its validity can be tested by not using stuff that are limited to that theory. We can prove it’s validity by observation, logical deduction or something else. The point is, it can be proved.

Can you prove the existence of god? Through observation I can’t, through logical deduction I can’t, through tests I can’t.

Given X is a subset of A, if A doesn’t even exist, X would NOT exist as well. Substitute A as god, X as bible and use it is quite obvious you can’t use bible to prove the existence of god. That’s why I said proving a theory using methods not limited to that theory is important

Does when the consequence comes matter?

quote.msg: Does when the consequence comes matter?

replies.msg:
God has the ability to stop sins. He refuses to do so and judgement comes in place. If he stop sins, there would be no judgement.


This is the reply before
You either act or don’t act. The matter of action is protection, NOT judging. He determined a day for judging you said. Let me explain how ridiculous is this crap!

God is almighty, he saw B got killed at a certain time period. He told himself hmm let me wait for a moment and JUDGE A later on, just let B die!

Wow god really loves B! Judging is never an instantaneous action, you wait and observe, then judge.

If you can actually prevent something, why even bother judging? The latter will not exist if you STOP the murderer!

God loves you!
